qas.question: What is another name for mesenteron?
Food goes in to the midgut after leaving where?
The majority of an insects digestion happens where?
What kind of projections are in the midgut wall?

context: Once food leaves <a1_0>the crop<a1_0/>, it passes to the <a0_0>midgut<a0_0/> (element 13 in numbered diagram), also known as <a2_0>the mesenteron<a2_0/>, where the majority of digestion takes place. <a3_0>Microscopic<a3_0/> projections from the midgut wall, called <a4_0>microvilli<a4_0/>, increase the surface area of the wall and allow more nutrients to be absorbed; they tend to be close to the origin of the midgut. In some insects, the role of the microvilli and where they are located may vary. For example, specialized microvilli producing digestive enzymes may more likely be near the end of the midgut, and absorption near the origin or beginning of the midgut.:32
